intro: Altensteinia marginata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved altensteinia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that often have a waxy surface. Its inflorescence consists of a spadix surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe. Altensteinia marginata is typically found in wetlands and marshy areas, where it plays a role in maintaining aquatic ecosystems.
